long_desc.thetext:
Looks like we simply forgot to add the irritant CompilerOptions.MissingNonNullByDefaultAnnotation to IrritantSet.NULL, although we report that "null" is the corresponding warning token (CompilerOptions.warningTokenFromIrritant).
The latter lets the quickfix propose @SW("null"), the former prevents the @SW from having any effect.
Need to check, if there's more similar omissions.
Wouldn't the following work for now: replace @SW("null") with an empty default: @NonNullByDefault({}) or (depending on your version of o.e.j.annotation) @NonNullByDefault(false) ?

(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #1) > Wouldn't the following work for now: replace @SW("null") with an empty > default: > @NonNullByDefault({})
Yes, NNBD is fine, I'd just have to import the annotations-jar to that project. Only the quickfix was faster at hand :-)
The actual solution is, to disable the compiler-null analysis for that project by overriding the workspace settings, as this won't clutter the code with any annotations, that get in the way should I later decide to incorporate null-analysis.

(In reply to Holger Klene from comment #2) > The actual solution is,
to fix this bug :)
I just wanted to make sure you have a workaround for now.
Verified for Mars 4.5M2 using I20140915-2000 build.
